meta.title: Session 35: PowerPoint View Tab & AI Tools
meta.description: Mastering PowerPoint Views (Normal, Sorter, Master Views), optimizing for print with Grayscale, and leveraging AI tools like Copilot and Lumen5.

studyTopics.hint: Normal for editing, Slide Sorter for reordering.
studyTopics.searchQuery: powerpoint views explained normal slide sorter reading
studyTopics.learningOutcome: Identify and use the correct view (Normal, Outline, Slide Sorter, Reading) for the task at hand.

studyTopics.hint: Edit once here to update every slide instantly.
studyTopics.searchQuery: how to use slide master in powerpoint tutorial
studyTopics.learningOutcome: Customize the master slide to ensure consistent fonts, logos, and layouts across the entire presentation.

studyTopics.hint: Rulers, Gridlines, and Guides help align objects.
studyTopics.searchQuery: powerpoint align objects using gridlines and guides
studyTopics.learningOutcome: Use visual aids to position text and images precisely on the slide.

studyTopics.hint: Checking how slides look when printed in black and white.
studyTopics.learningOutcome: Optimize presentations for non-color printing to ensure readability.

studyTopics.hint: Copilot writes slides; Lumen5 makes videos.
studyTopics.learningOutcome: Understand how AI can automate slide creation and convert text content into engaging videos.

questions.question: Which view is the default view in PowerPoint where you write and design your slides?
questions.explanation: Normal View is the main editing view, which includes the slide pane, thumbnail pane, and notes pane.

questions.question: If you want to place a company logo on the top-right corner of *every* slide automatically, where should you insert it?
questions.explanation: Changes made to the Slide Master (top slide in the hierarchy) are automatically applied to all associated slides in the presentation.

questions.question: Which view displays all slides as small thumbnails, making it easy to drag and drop them to change their order?
questions.explanation: Slide Sorter view gives a high-level overview of the entire presentation sequence.

questions.question: Lumen5 is an AI tool primarily used to:
options: Convert text/blog posts into engaging video content
questions.explanation: Lumen5 uses AI to analyze text content and automatically match it with relevant stock footage to create videos.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'Grayscale' option in the View tab?
options: To make the presentation look old
To see how the slides will look when printed on a black and white printer
questions.explanation: Grayscale view helps you verify that text and graphs are still legible without color before printing.

questions.question: Which checkbox in the 'Show' group would you enable to see a horizontal and vertical ruler for measuring formatting?
questions.explanation: The Ruler option toggles the measurement rulers on the top and left of the slide pane.

questions.question: Microsoft PowerPoint Copilot uses AI to:
options: Create entire presentations, summarize slides, and organize ideas from a prompt
questions.explanation: Copilot integrates LLMs (Large Language Models) into PowerPoint to assist in creating and refining presentations.

questions.question: What does 'Fit to Window' do in the Zoom group?
options: Resizes the slide so it fills the current available space in the window
questions.explanation: Fit to Window adjusts the zoom level instantly so the whole slide is visible.

questions.question: Which Master View allows you to customize how the printed handouts (3 slides per page, etc.) will look?
questions.explanation: Handout Master controls the layout, headers, and footers for printed audience handouts.

questions.question: The 'Switch Windows' command is useful when:
options: You have multiple presentations open and want to change which one is active
You want to change the view to Slide Sorter
You want to play a video
questions.explanation: Switch Windows lists all open PowerPoint files so you can quickly jump between them.

questions.question: Which visual aid helps you verify if three objects are perfectly aligned with each other?
questions.explanation: Guides (movable lines) and Gridlines (fixed grid) are specifically designed for precise alignment.

questions.question: To see the structure of your presentation as a text-only list of titles and bullets, which view should you use?
questions.explanation: Outline View focuses on the text content (outline) of the slides rather than the graphics.

questions.question: What happens if you click 'New Window' in the View tab?
options: A new window opens displaying the *same* presentation
questions.explanation: New Window allows you to view the same presentation in two separate windows (e.g., to edit slide 1 while looking at slide 50).

questions.question: The 'Notes Page' view is primarily used to:
options: View the slide along with the speaker notes below it in a printable format
questions.explanation: Notes Page view shows how the slide and its associated speaker notes will look if printed.

questions.question: Which AI feature analyzes your slide content and automatically suggests professional design layouts in a sidebar?
questions.explanation: PowerPoint Designer (Design Ideas) offers automatic layout and image suggestions.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a group in the View Tab?
questions.explanation: Animations is a separate top-level Tab, not a group within the View Tab.

questions.question: In the View tab, 'Macros' allow you to:
options: Automate repetitive tasks by running recorded scripts
questions.explanation: Macros are used for automation, similar to Excel and Word.

questions.question: What does the 'Cascade' option in the Windows group do?
options: Stacks all open PowerPoint windows so you can see the title bars of each
questions.explanation: Cascade arranges all open windows in an overlapping stack.

questions.question: Which view allows you to present the slideshow in a window (not full screen) while still seeing other apps?
questions.explanation: Reading View plays the animations and transitions like a slideshow but keeps the window controls visible.

questions.question: If you want to edit the formatting of the 'Speaker Notes' area for printing, which Master View do you use?
questions.explanation: The Notes Master allows you to customize the layout and font of the Notes Pages.
